div.br:
Join us for a tuition-free hands-on learning environment in environmental sciences, including field trips, laboratory experiments and working in the school's own greenhouse!
Wildwood Environmental Academy is a safe and secure free public community school offering a challenging academic program aligned with Common Core State Standards. The academy will be housed in two buildings on the same campus. We have turtles, fish, lizards, a ferret, mice, bearded dragons, snakes, rabbits, chinchillas and guinea pigs, which the students enjoy working with and help to care for. Our greenhouse is accessible to all students and an environmental education is on staff to assist in the full integration of the environmental sciences.
Features:
- Free public charter school with all day kindergarten
- Hands-on Learning including a full science and MAC lab
- Small Class Sizes to foster individualized instruction
- Greenhouse, various gardens and active bee hives onsite
​- Frequent field extensions throughout the community
- K-12 education with focus on whole child development
- Award winning, highly qualified, caring and dedicated staff
- Use of data to support individualized instruction
- Small school atmosphere with animal friendly classrooms
​- Rigorous grading scale and high academic standards
- College Credit Plus opportunities with local universities
- Highly effective support staff
​

hr.div:
Wildwood Environmental Academy is very proud of our environmental efforts both in and out of the classroom. The school is known for their ongoing environmental missions and the latest recognitions include:
​WEA was recognized by Wild Ones with the "2015 Native School Landscape Award."
In the Spring of 2015 S.A.V.E. (Science Alliance for Valuing the Environment) awarded WEA as the "Eco School of the Year!"
WEA was the recipient of a generous donation of 50 solar panels from First Solar.

span.span: Located in Maumee, Ohio - Wildwood Environmental Academy is known for its ongoing environmental missions, both in and out of the classroom. They recently received the Jerry Banister Green Award for its dedicated work.

Under the leadership of Ms. Elizabeth Lewin, this wonderful public charter school has soared having received numerous honors - which includes a 'School of Excellence' award from the Ohio Coalition for Quality Education for their strong academics.

span.strong: All Board Meetings will be held at 4:00 pm (unless otherwise noted) at

span.br:
1628 Henthorne Drive
Maumee, OH 43537
​
April 8, 2020
May 13, 2020
​June 10, 2020

div.font: The Board of Directors recognizes the importance of collaborating in order to help students have good attendance at school. Therefore, school employees and volunteers, community members and local juvenile court judges, as well as any other stakeholders, are invited to attend the June meeting of the board of directors to collaborate in developing the academy's Attendance, Truancy, and Automatic Withdrawal Policy.​​​

h2.font: It's GREAT to be a WILDWOOD Warrior!

font.font:
​We are happy to welcome you and your family to Wildwood Environmental Academy.
To begin the enrollment process, please fill out the "Intent to Enroll Now" form and submit the online enrollment application.
​An enrollment specialist will contact you soon to set up a tour and to complete the application process.
​Just need more information? Contact Us and a member of our staff will provide any information you may need.

span.font: Toledo Walleye Partners With Wildwood Environmental Academy

font.span: Wildwood Environmental Academy students had the opportunity to visit the Toledo Walleye, a mid-level professional hockey team that is affiliated with the Detroit Red Wings. Students were able to visit the Huntington Center, where the Toledo Walleye play their games, and visit with the players. They had many opportunities to interact with the players, including spending time on the ice, eating lunch together and engaging in thoughtful conversations. Students talked with the team about
life in college, goals versus dreams and how they can sometimes both be achieved

. Students were nominated by their teachers to attend based on many factors including perseverance and hard work in the classroom. Those who were chosen to attend are already asking to go back again next year.

br.span: See the video below of Susan Brimmer, assistant school leader at WEA, discussing the visit.

br.br:
​
This partnership was made possible by WEA’s Sponsor, Ohio Council of Community Schools. Many thanks to Toledo Walleye and OCCS for this wonderful experience!

br.span: Wildwood Environmental Academy does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the non-discrimination policies: Elizabeth Lewin, School Leader, 1628 Henthorne, 419.868.9885, elizabeth.lewin@leonagroup.com
